Fact: On this date in 1962, Eritrea was made a province of the Ethiopian Empire
On this date in 1988, Yasser Arafat issued a Declaration of Independence for the Palestinian state.
On this date in 1988, Benazir Bhutto was elected as the first woman in modern history to lead a Muslim country as the PM of Pakistan
On this date in 1973, Richard Nixon declared “I am not a crook”.
On this date in 1978, Jim Jones his followers died in the Jonestown massacre.
On this date in 2017, cult leader Charles Manson died in prison in Bakersfield, CA.
On this date in 1910, Leo Tolstoy died of heart failure at the railroad station of Astapovo.
On this date in 1920, Stan Musial, legendary first baseman for the St. Louis Cardinals, was born.
On this date in 1963, JFK was assassinated in Dallas, TX
On this date in 1990, famed author Roald Dahl died in Oxford, England
On this date in 2001, Turkey ratified changes to their legal code and made women equal to men under the law.
On this date in 2020, Diego Maradona died at age 60 in Dique Luján, Argentina
On this date in 2008, ten gunmen in Mumbai launched a series of attacks, killing 174 people over three days.
On this date in 1924, the first “Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade” was held in NYC, NY.
On this date in 2012, Peter Jackson’s “The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey” premiered in New Zealand.
On this date in 1947, the UN approves of the partition of Palestine which introduced the state of Israel.
On this date in 2007, daredevil “Evel Knievel” died at 69 in Clearwater, FL.
On this date in 1955, Rosa Parks refused to surrender her bus seat sparking a civil rights, bus boycott.
On this date in 1993, Pablo Escobar was killed in a shootout with authorities in Medellin, Colombia.
On this date in 1984, there was a major gas leak in Bhopal, India.
On this date in 1970, Shawn Corey Carter was born in Brooklyn, NY. He is better known as Jay-Z.
On this date in 2013, Nelson Mandela died at 95.
On this date in 1973, Gerald Ford was sworn in as VP after Spiro Agnew resigned.
On this date in 1941, Pearl Harbor was attacked by Japanese bombers in Hawaii.
On this date in 1980, John Lennon was assassinated by a crazed fan in New York City, NY.
On this date in 1869, the first ever traffic light was raised near Westminster Bridge in London.
On this date in 2005, Richard Pryor died at 65 in LA, CA
On this date in 1988, the U.S. House of Representatives recommended three articles of impeachment against Bill Clinton for the Monica Lewinsky affairs.
On this date in 1964, Kenya became a republic.
On this date in 1989, Taylor Swift was born. 14 years later, Saddam Hussein was captured by U.S. forces during the Iraq war.
On this date in 1799, George Washington died at 67.
On this date in 2010, the Leaning Tower of Pisa was reopened in Pisa, Italy.
On this date in 1773, American colonists threw 342 chests of tea into the Boston Harbor, later to be called the Boston Tea Party.
On this date in 2011, North Korean leader Kim Jong Il died and was succeeded by current leader Kim Jong Un.
On this date in 1865, slavery was abolished in the United States by the 13th amendment.
On this date in 1988, Bill Clinton was impeached by the U.S. House of Representatives.
On this date in 1989, the United States launched Operation Just Cause, a military invasion of Panama
On this date in 1898, Marie Curie (and Pierre Curie) discovered Radium
